title: Awful Customer Support
content:
I donâ€™t usually write reviews for apps, but TikTokâ€™s support service is genuinely awful. I had an issue with my username that was clearly caused by a glitch on TikTokâ€™s endâ€”not mine.

I tried changing my username, and although the app said the change was successful, my old username still showed upâ€”not just for others, but for me too. I attempted to change it again, and surprisingly, TikTok let meâ€”even though thereâ€™s normally a 30-day limit between username changes. At one point, both usernames seemed to be somehow linked to my account.

When I tried to get help, I had to go through their AI chatbot, which was completely useless. It didnâ€™t even consider that the problem might be on TikTokâ€™s side. So I emailed TikTok support directlyâ€”no response. Nothing.

Eventually, I gave up and tried using a completely different username. As soon as I did, TikTok suspended my accountâ€”for absolutely no clear reason.

This was an incredibly frustrating experience, and their support system is practically nonexistent. Really disappointing.

title: Wow
content:
TikTok is, without a doubt, one of the most innovative, entertaining, and culturally influential social media platforms of the modern digital era, and it continues to evolve and dominate online spaces in 2025 with no signs of slowing down. Since its explosion in popularity a few years ago, TikTok has fundamentally changed how people interact with content, shifting attention from long-form consumption to short, punchy, addictive videos that cater perfectly to fast-paced lifestyles and shorter attention spans. One of the platformâ€™s most praised features is its incredibly intelligent algorithm, which learns what you like with jaw-dropping accuracyâ€”even after just a few minutes of scrollingâ€”and creates a feed (the For You Page, or FYP) that is uniquely tailored to your interests. Whether youâ€™re into comedy, anime, cooking, gaming, aesthetics, dancing, fashion, makeup, horror stories, nostalgic edits, psychology facts, cleaning videos, chaotic memes, life hacks, productivity tips, or something super niche like frog memes or obscure historical facts, TikTok will find it and serve it up faster than any other app ever has. Unlike many other social media platforms that focus heavily on follower count or curated feeds, TikTok levels the playing field by giving virtually anyone the chance to go viralâ€”even users with zero followersâ€”simply by posting something clever, relatable, or engaging. This has opened the door for countless creators and small businesses to gain visibility, grow audiences, and build careers they never imagined possible, all from their phones. The in-app video editor is intuitive yet shockingly powerful, making it easy to add effects, music, filters, captions, and transitions without needing external tools or any prior editing experience. Combined with the massive library of trending sounds, memes, and songs, the barrier to entry for content creation is incredibly low while the potential for creativity is sky-high.

TikTokâ€™s community aspect is also something special. Itâ€™s not just an app to watch videosâ€”itâ€™s a living ecosystem of trends, inside jokes, duets, stitches, collabs, debates, and responses that all feed into a culture of participation and creativity. From â€œCorecoreâ€ edits that explore digital emotions, to â€œStorytimeâ€ creators who share the most outrageous or heartfelt life experiences, to â€œPOVâ€ actors bringing characters to life with surprising depth, TikTok encourages users to be bold, weird, honest, funny, or whatever else they feel like being. Whole subcultures thrive within the appâ€”whether itâ€™s â€œBookTok,â€ where authors and readers boost novels into bestsellers, â€œCleanTok,â€ where people watch satisfying organizing videos for relaxation, or â€œAltTok,â€ which leans into offbeat, surreal humor. These digital communities form naturally and are surprisingly welcoming, making the app feel like more than just entertainmentâ€”it becomes a space to belong. TikTok also pushes boundaries in education, with teachers, scientists, therapists, and other professionals using the platform to break down complex topics in ways that are digestible and interesting. You can literally learn a new language, explore history, or understand mental health betterâ€”just from scrolling your feed. That balance of fun and learning is something few platforms have managed to nail.

Another powerful part of TikTok is how deeply it influences trends, both online and in real life. Entire fashion movements, catchphrases, beauty products, and music careers have been born from TikTok. Itâ€™s the app where new slang spreads, where viral challenges begin, and where cultural moments happen. Major brands, celebrities, and even politicians now use the platform to connect with audiences, proving its place as a mainstream powerhouse. Music, in particular, has seen a huge impactâ€”countless songs have gone from obscure to chart-topping hits just because they were used in a viral TikTok. Some artists now design songs specifically to hit on TikTok, focusing on catchy intros or lyrics that people can dance or lip-sync to. Beyond music, the platform also gives a massive voice to people from all backgrounds, often boosting creators from marginalized communities in a way that feels more authentic than traditional media. It helps amplify stories that matter, raise awareness about social issues, and shine a light on voices that are often overlooked. Whether you want to laugh, cry, vibe, rant, learn, or just feel less alone, there is a corner of TikTok thatâ€™s perfect for youâ€”and it will find you.

TikTok is also incredibly fun and satisfying to use, with constant updates, seasonal trends, themed filters, and even live streams that bring more interactivity to the app. Unlike other social platforms that can feel toxic or overly curated, TikTok thrives on relatability and authenticity. People donâ€™t need to look perfect or have expensive equipmentâ€”sometimes the rawest, most unfiltered content does the best. And while every app has its flaws, TikTokâ€™s ability to unite entertainment, expression, education, and connection in one sleek experience is unmatched. Whether youâ€™re a casual scroller or an ambitious creator, the app constantly offers new things to try, trends to follow, and laughs to be had. In short, TikTok isnâ€™t just an appâ€”itâ€™s a full-on cultural universe that has become part of how people express themselves, discover new ideas, connect with others, and shape the world around them. Itâ€™s creative, chaotic, clever, and constantly changing, and for anyone who loves being part of something bigger, TikTok is absolutely worth the hype.

title: i suffer
content: To be frank, this review is not speaking to the character or nature of this app but rather how insufferable it has been to use. I am not able to open any videos that i search up, my followers dont stick, when i follow people it unfollows. These are all things I experience that make this app horrible. Though I of course love the app TikTok, I have realized there have been quite a few changes to the UI that make certain parts of this app become genuinely aggravating and unbearable. More specifically, the linking to Instagram. They keep updating it yet. It seems that the updates don't do anything but Americanize it yet not make it better. There's a glitch in trying to link your Instagram in your TikTok bio, yet if you click someone's link and it leads you to Instagram, TikTok will not let you export the link to Safari. It will just force you to use the website in the app, which is weird and feels like some type of invasion of privacy. Other things have been done to the UI like the sensitivity when sliding in between because they obviously really want you to use TikTok shop and how overbearing the TikTok shop push is on the For You page. I try to actively avoid any video that has TikTok shop linked even if I do want to see

title: Horrible Support Team
content:
Itâ€™s unacceptable that it takes weeks for users to receive meaningful feedback from a support team. With the high volume of users on this app, responses should be prompt and genuinely helpful. Even with AI, a free or affordable app offering AI functionality outperforms TikTokâ€™s support by a wide margin.
I was previously suspended for being â€œunderage,â€ despite meeting the age requirements in the guidelines, which left me confused and frustrated. Submitting an appeal, which shouldnâ€™t have been necessary, took days for the support team to address. After regaining access to my account, I noticed my DM and gifting permissions on live streams were restricted. I realized I had accidentally entered the wrong birth year during age verification.
Expecting a proper resolution, I submitted a ticket explaining the mistake in my date of birth and requested a correction. Days passed with no response. I submitted multiple additional requests and even emailed the feedback team, which responded after hoursâ€”only to receive another AI-generated reply addressing an entirely different issue. I responded clearly, stating:
â€œIâ€™ve submit an appeal, and itâ€™s not about a ban. Itâ€™s about changing my date of birth, as I have chosen the wrong year (â€“â€“) while I was born in â€“â€“. This has caused me to lose my DM access, and I have submit multiple ignored tickets about that issue. I would like actual help, as I feel itâ€™s just being ignored.â€
For privacy, Iâ€™ve omitted the specific years here, but I included them in the email. The response I received was:
â€œHi there,
Thanks for contacting TikTok.
We understand how important your account is to you, so we thank you for your patience!
After careful review, there are no current violations of our Community Guidelines and you should have full access to your account.
We apologize for any inconvenience, and thank you again for your patience. Happy TikTokâ€™ing!
Best, The TikTok Team.â€
This response was irrelevant and infuriating. Continuously submitting tickets, hoping for a human response, only to be met with an ineffective AI system is unacceptable. TikTok needs to prioritize timely, accurate, and human-driven support to resolve user issues effectively.
